history.content:
EECS 127 is a must given your interests.

Take EECS 126 instead of Stat 140. It goes deeper into the probabilistic intuition of ML. 

Consider taking some grad classes as well. If you did well in the above classes, you can probably talk to instructors to get access into classes like CS281A, CS285, CS288, EE226A, EE229A.

If you like theory, consider some of the heavily theoretical ML/Stats classes like Stat 210A. Also Math 104 is essential for the math intuition for theoretical ML

Signal processing classes are also great for ML intuition. Try EE120 or some of the EE225x series classes.

So if I want to do a ML concentration as a math major, what courses would one recommend?

I’ve taken 170, 189, 110, and I am planning to take stat 140 for next sem just for reference.

My current guess is EECS 127 but other than that idk what else.
history.subject: Classes to take
